title: jQuery: Novice to Ninja: New Kicks And Tricks
description: This concise yet in-depth guide takes you inside scope and closures, two core concepts you need to know to become a more efficient and effective JavaScript programmer.
author: Earle Castledine & Craig Sharkie

title: jQuery Fundamentals
description: jQuery Fundamentals is designed to get you comfortable working through common problems you'll be called upon to solve using jQuery.
author: Rebecca Murphey

title: jQuery, jQuery UI, and jQuery Mobile: Recipes and Examples
description: jQuery makes it easier than ever for developers to build exceptionally robust, cross-platform websites and mobile apps. This extremely useful guide brings together more than one hundred self-contained, downloadable examples, each with an in-depth explanation of how the code works and how to adapt it for your own needs.
author: Adriaan de Jonge & Phillip Dutson

title: Head First jQuery (Brain-Friendly Guides)
description: If you want to learn—and understand—how to create interactive web pages, unobtrusive script, and cool animations that don't kill your browser, this book is for you.
author: Ryan Benedetti & Ronan Cranley

title: jQuery Cookbook
description: Getting started with the jQuery library is easy, but it can take years to fully realize its breadth and depth; jQuery Cookbook shortens the learning curve considerably. The recipes start with the basics and then move into practical use cases with tested solutions to common web development hurdles.
author: Cody Lindley
